title_full:
Able Noise

              —
              High Tide
            
              (World Of Echo)
label: World Of Echo
description:
Like Still House Plants, Able Noise challenge any preconceived notions of post-rock, cutting into the raw material mined by Slint and Bark Psychosis and sculpting it into bold new shapes, folding time in on itself in the process.

Able Noise - aka Dutch guitarist George Knegtel and Greek drummer Alex Andropoulos - formed way back in 2017, cutting their teeth playing improvised, site-specific live shows that would shift depending on the variables of each space and audience. Their studio practice... more

label: Dauw
description:
Crumbling tape loops disintegrate into a pastel fantasy of soft-focus drones on Finnish sound artist Olli Aarni latest, exposing the beating heart at the center of his process. Essential listening for fans of Civilistjävel!, Kevin Drumm or KMRU.

Like 2022's Students of Decay-released 'Koko maailma', 'Yö näkyy' is comprised of two ethereal long-form compositions that the Vantaa-based artist has prepped rigorously for ultimate horizontal impact. Aarni is a skilled field recordist, but here... more

release:
Quaker Run Wildfire (10/24/23/ - 11/17/23) for Fiddle and Guitar
            
              (Longform Editions)
title_full:
Daniel Bachman

              —
              Quaker Run Wildfire (10/24/23/ - 11/17/23) for Fiddle and Guitar
            
              (Longform Editions)
label: 10/24/23/ - 11/17/23 for Fiddle and Guitar
description:
Daniel Bachman is an artist, musician, and independent scholar primarily interested in the folk histories of Virginia. Bachman has released eleven full length records since 2011 and toured extensively internationally and throughout the US, garnering wide acclaim. Much of his recent work examines the earliest influence of extractive industry in colonial British North America and how it relates to climate breakdown in the 21st century. He currently lives in Madison county Virginia.

Artist... more

title_full:
Ka Baird

              —
              Bearings: Soundtracks for the Bardos
            
              (RVNG Intl.)
label: RVNG Intl.
description:
New York mainstay Ka Baird returns with their most captivating full-length, a real heady trip informed by their ecstatic live performances rocketing classic Downtown minimalism towards far-flung galaxies. The album features a cast of avant-garde mavericks including Greg Fox, Max Eilbacher, Jon Mueller, Nate Wooley and others, and comes highly recommended for anyone into Laurie Anderson., Anna Homler/Breadwoman, Rashad Becker, Ben Vince x Heather Leigh.

'Bearings...' provides a... more

title_full:
Eric Chenaux Trio

              —
              Delights Of My Life
            
              (Constellation)
label: Constellation
description:
Deliciously languid and summery songwriting by Canadian guitarist Eric Chenaux, buoyed by organ and drums on an instantly classic-sounding batch of smoky jazz-soul ballads and torchsong with subtle experimental inflections

“Following the release of Eric Chenaux’s last album Say Laura (2022), The Guardian wrote “the Canadian songwriter has one of the all-time great singing voices in popular music, an intensely romantic Chet Baker-ish instrument that seems to float with piercing... more

title_full:
Oliver Coates

              —
              Throb, shiver, arrow of time
            
              (RVNG Intl.)
label: RVNG Intl.
description:
Preeminent scorer and maverick cellist Oliver Coates, member of the London Contemporary Orchestra and occasional spar for everyone from Mica Levi to MF DOOM, carries over his commissions for moving image into the fever dream-like instrumental narrative arc of his 3rd album for RVNG Intl., a glorious display of his emotional register, saturated with absorbing harmonic-textural colour and dissonance and featuring a standout vocal cameo from Malibu.

In the wake of celebrated... more

title_full:
Clarissa Connelly

              —
              World of Work
            
              (Warp Records)
label: Warp Records
description:
Inspired by French philosophy, medieval letters and romantic poetry, Clarissa Connelly's first Warp full-length is an ornate lattice of Celtic and Scandinavian history and mythology, packed with heady prog-folk epics that tumble into church bell snippets and ambient choral workouts. Ambitious stuff, and all the better for it - RIYL Kate Bush, Julia Holter or ML Buch.

We've been drip-fed pieces of this one for months at this point, and thankfully the album itself is worth the wait. It works best in... more

label: Shukai
description:
The wide-eyed, theatric art-pop and psych-folk wonders of Svitlana Nianio’s early band, Cukor Bila Smert’, come to light via Ukrainian reissue specialists Shukai on this mindboggling 31-track, 90 minute anthology of studio recordings made between 1990-1993, contorting gothic folk around brittle, calypso-inspired drum loops and oddball new wave bullets, a sort of missing link on the spectrum between Broadcast, Stroom, Lubos Fiser and Les Disques Du Crépescule.

Cukor Bila Smert’ (trans:... more

title_full:
Hmot

              —
              There Will Come Gentle Rain
            
              (Warm Winters Ltd.)
label: Warm Winters Ltd.
description:
Teaming up with Rupert Clervaux, Adela Mede, Eldar Tagi and Tuvan vocalist Sainkho Namtchylak, Stas Shärifullá (aka HMOT) digs into his academic research on collective memory and sonic traditions on his latest Warm Winters plate, deconstructing folk legends and cultural dissonance in the process.

It's fitting that the first sound we hear on 'There Will Come Gentle Rain' is an acoustic twang, that roots the album in folk traditions before it veers off into the unknown. The most... more

title_full:
Katov Syn(th)

            —
            Tu, kde žijem, žiješ, žijeme

label: Hyperdub
description:
Arriving on Hyperdub for their first proper solo release in ages, Mica Levi delivers a 17 minute (12 on the digitals) orchestral dream pop epic, dispersing hallucinatory vocals buried in silvery clouds of strings and a motorik rhythm, somewhere in the vicinity of work by Dean Blunt and A.R. Kane, but ultimately just Mica’s thing.

There's a fantastical quality to Levi's music that's present even in their most stripped-to-the-bone productions, from 2017's DDS-released classic 'Delete Beach' to 2020's... more

title_full:
Kali Malone

              —
              All Life Long
            
              (Ideologic Organ)
label: Ideologic Organ
description:
Kali Malone’s new solo album, All Life Long, featuring composition for choir, pipe organ and brass ensemble, following her acclaimed breakthrough album The Sacrificial Code (2019).

"Kali Malone’s new album All Life Long presents her first compositions for organ since 2019’s breakthrough album The Sacrificial Code alongside interrelated pieces for voice and brass performed by Macadam Ensemble and Anima Brass. Over the course of twelve pieces, harmonic themes and patterns... more

label: 3XL
description:
Years in the making, naemi’s ambitious, sprawling debut album for 3XL features contributions from Erika de Casier, Ulla, Huerco S, Ben Bondy, Florian TM Zeisig, NAP and label boss Shy, plus many others, on a gorgeously brooding double album braiding heart-liquifying dreampop guitars with weightless clouds of sublime ambience. A pensive and poetic celebration of love and friendship, it’s the most beautiful, vital music released by 3XL to date.

Formerly known as exael, naemi channels a... more

label: Mondoj
description:
Polish vocalist/multi-instrumentalist Antonina Nowacka returns with a mesmerising weave of wordless, operatic vocals, early music and a kind of fractal ambience last heard on Kara-Lis Coverdale’s totemic Grafts, arranging zither, organ, ocarina and '90s synths for an album that sits half way between New Age and the electro-acoustic avant garde.

Nobody sings quite like Antonina Nowacka. Her voice took us by surprise on 2020's 'Lamunan', an album that she dreamt up in a cave in Indonesia... more

You've heard of American Primitive by now, and NTS does the heavy lifting here, compiling responses to John Fahey's ideas and some parallel experiments from across Europe. It's ingenious, visionary material that draws indelible lines between US guitar music and its roots - from flamenco and folk to liturgical forms.

During the 1950s, US guitarist John Fahey developed a fingerstyle technique that he would dub "American primitive guitar". Taking ideas from folk, blues and jazz, stripping away... more

label: Unsound
description:
Polish guitarist Raphael Rogiński digs into Eastern European mythology on his gorgeous latest full-length, shimmering traces of archaic folk music, American primitive guitar, jazz and ambient forms into a dreamy meditation on memory, wonder and loss. Crucial midnight listening, whether you're into Laraaji, Loren Connors, Merope, Popol Vuh or Daniel Lanois.

If you heard last year's sublime 'Talàn', or Rogiński's transcendent re-interpretations of Henry Purcell, Bach and John Coltrane, then... more

label: Moikai
description: The first release on Jim O'Rourke's legendary Moikai imprint in over two decades, 'Spectral Evolution' is a defining statement from Portuguese vanguard Rafael Toral, an album of subtly orchestral, jazz-inspired guitar music that's been slowed to a vertiginous crawl. Using his arsenal of hand-made synths to sing like birds around stretched, steel-wound drones, he evokes Bach, Loren Connors, Gavin Bryars and Rhys Chatham on a longform piece full of conventional chord progressions and... more

label: Mappa Editions
description:
Copenhagen-based Slovakian artist Michaela Turcerová figures out a new language for the saxophone on 'alene et', taking the instrument's incidental sounds - like key presses and breathy exhalations - and transforming them into complex rhythms and hissing textures. RIYL Bendik Giske, Pita or Nakibembe Embaire Group. 

Turcerová covered her sax in microphones to producer 'alene et', working out exactly how each gesture might sound if it was amplified in a different way. And it was worth... more

label: Warm Winters Ltd.
description:
Warm Winters celebrate five years of activity and 40 releases with a selection of meditations on liminality from 12 artists from the Slovak and Czech underground, including Adela Mede, Richard Hronský, Magdaléna Manderlová and Tom​á​š Niesner.

'Prah' means threshold, and Mede ushers us over with the ghostly 'Horľavina', a blurry follow-up to her excellent 'Ne L​é​pj A Vir​á​gra' album from last year. Singing over warped traces of folk - guitar strums, accordion squeaks - she introduces... more

title_full:
YELLOW SWANS

              —
              Out Of Practice I
            
              (Yellow Swans Archive)
label: Yellow Swans Archive
description:
Yellow Swans are back with their first newly recorded material in 15 years, salting their incinerated walls of sound thru lopsided concrète loops and yawping feedback, inevitably cooling into dreamy, fractal ambience. We're floored, once again.

Billed as the first in a series of releases documenting the duo’s reunion last year, 'Out of Practice I' finds Pete Swanson and Gabriel Mindel Saloman raiding their archive to excavate a bunch of fragments now arranged into "VERRRRY loose" songs. The... more
